alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Sagadahoc; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 4:26PM EDT until September 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... York County in southwestern Maine... Cumberland County in southwestern Maine... Southern Sagadahoc County in south central Maine... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 425 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lebanon to Kennebunk to 10 miles southeast of Kennebunkport, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Portland, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Alfred, Sanford, Naples, Cumberland, Saco, Gorham, Falmouth, Kennebunk, Cape Elizabeth, Buxton, Freeport, Gray, Lebanon, and Hollis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 95 between mile markers 22 and 73. This also includes... Sebago Lake, Fortunes Rock Beach, Higgins Beach, Crescent Beach State Park, and Scarborough Beach State Park. Peaks Island, Long Island, Cushing Island, Cousins Island, and Bailey Island. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
